name: tree
title: Tree Aloes
description: Aloes that grow to small tree size with branching trunks that form multiple heads and have the general, branched profile of a tree.

name: single_head_tree
title: Single Head Tree Aloes
description: Aloes that grow to small tree size that form a single head atop the trunk and have the profile of a plam tree.

name: branching
title: Branching Aloes
description: In appearance branching Aloes are somewhere between a small tree and a large shrub in size.

name: single_head_stemless
title: Single Head Stemless Aloes
description: A group of Aloes with a solitary rosette and without a stem. These plant do not create offsets or produce just a few offsets at maturity.

name: large_clumping
title: Large Clumping Aloes
description: A group of larger sized Aloes that spread by creating offsets (suckers)

name: clumping
title: Small to Medium Clumping Aloes
description: A group of small to medium sized Aloes that spread by creating offsets (suckers)

name: red
title: Red Aloes
description: A handful of Aloes have a burgandy-red blush to the leaves either seasonly or year round.

name: mosaic
title: Mosaic Aloes
description: Similar to maculate Aloes but spots are more frequent, stretched and knit together giving the impression of a mosaic.

name: maculate
title: Spotted Aloes
description: A variety of hybridized, low, clustering Aloes which are spotted (maculate).

name: grass
title: Grass Aloes
description: Named for their thin leaved grassy appearance.
